text: Michael Djakoff (1872 â€“ 19 September 1959) was a Russian track cyclist. He won the silver medal at the 1896 ICA Track Cycling World Championships, in the amateur motor-paced event. In 1896 he left Moscow, and with a British license he became twice champion of the United Kingdom in the half lap event. == References == Category:1872 births Category:1959 deaths Category:Russian cyclists
title: Michael Djakoff
